result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob D Meyer

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob D Meyer appeared by video.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Jacob D Meyer.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Review Hearing.  Court is advised that the defendant wishes to withdraw counsel. Discussion with parties placed on the record. Court holds decision in abeyance until the next court date, and orders case adjourned for an additional status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Received and filed: updated Jury Instructions
Received and filed: updated Addendum to Plea Questionnaire.
Received and filed:  updated Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Defendant Jacob D Meyer in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter scheduled for Final Pre-Trial. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Jury Trial set for 8/22/2022 is VACATED.

Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob D Meyer in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Court in receipt of a DPA agreement and change of plea paperwork. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement. Due to reasons stated on the record, court was unable to complete the DPA plea. Court set final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Court set filing deadlines with the parties. Defense has until July 18th, 2022 to submit any crime lab reports to defense. July 27th, 2022 the defense has to file any change of plea paperwork or DPA. Parties have until August 1st, 2022 to file any and all trial documents. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

All parties are notified that effective July 30th, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Paul R. Van Grunsven, Branch 28, in Room 632 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Jacob D Meyer in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Patrick T. Franken for Amy Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Court sets a deadline of 4/8/22 for discovery with the exception of any crime lab reports. Any motions and/or change of plea forms to be filed by 5/13/22.  Case is adjourned to Br. 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob D Meyer in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Oak Creek Officer A. Schnering. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob D Meyer in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Romenesko is F2 in out of custody intake; unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jacob D Meyer in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/28/22 @ 2:30p
